 The Lord of the Rings

Oh my, oh my! Wow!

It was brilliant! They cut out and changed a lot of things from the book but that was to be ecpected (poor Tom Bombadil). The artwork was excellant, visually astounding! I loved Rivendell and Lothlorien espically.

Galadriel and Bilbo were scary when they got 'tested' I loved Legolas! He was brilliant with his bow, all the action scenes were great.

I didn't like the way they cut out things (Tom Bombadil, a lot when they were travelling to Rivendell, the pony) and changed some things, they made the dark rider's horses brown. Brown!!!

Anyway, gotta go see it again!

Registered: Oct 2001
Location: Incommincado Tyler Durden says: Do we really need another women?
Posts: 3087

 Five Stars, 100%, 10/10, Number One

Go and see this film. If you don't then you will have missed the greatest story ever to be told in the big screen. Goa'uld go and see it if you're reading this. The Lord of The Rings is no Mummy Returns. The story has some great mythology that rivals that of the Norse mythology. Yes the Norse mythology that has inspired the little grey men in Stargate SG-1 who are known as the Asgard.

Peter Jackson, The Director, has excelled himself and brought us a film that is both Arthouse and blockbusting. The story was solid as has been proved with the world wide success of the three novels, (The Fellowship of The Ring, The Two Towers, and The return of The King). Weta Digital, the company who created all of the Special Effects are sure to become one of the Main contenders with ILM in special effects Wizardry (pardon the pun). Star Wars is no match against this film especially if they keep putting in Jar Jar Binks. Even without Jar Jar Binks, the film is no match to this. Star Wars is too much about the Special Effects wheras Tolkiens stories where about how where his imagination could take his. He did not think about developing new technologies to create his world. However, we do owe george Lucas and ILM for developing the Digital world of cinema to the stage it is at now. The Lord of The Rins might never have been possible without him.

The films has a star studded cast whp perform their roles very well and believabley. if this film don't encourage the writers of Stargate to try and devlop their mythological aspects of the show much further and deeper then god knows what they will do?

Go and See this film asap! What more can one say. For anyone who has seen it, what is your favourite part?

Can't believe they're holding the other two until next (or next next) year!! Does anyone know if TFOTR will be out on Sky or video by next Xmas?

I know, presdoc, I realised after I'd posted it.

I'm now totally in love with Legolas and Aragorn, and also quite into Viggo Mortensen (sp?) and Orlando Bloom. Has anyone seen any docu's on LOTRs? So far I've seen one on MTV and ITV. Apparently, Orlando (Orli) aka Legolas does bungee jumping and paragliding(?) in his free time!! (The ITV docu showed him actually bungee jumping outta a cable car!! ) I think he got Elijah too as well... And plus I've hard twice that apparently Viggo (Aragron) got a tooth knocked out during a swordfight (he insisted on doing all of his stunts), but he was so eager to carry on filming, that he went to the dentists during a lunch break, and got it superglued back in, and carried on!! That's dedication! Also, Cate Blanchett was saying how theres a kind of ... dedcation, or something, to this film, which, I think, is really cool, that they respect the book, and y'know, *want* the film to be successful, not only for the money. Although, considering they spent like, 2 years, together, filming it (each celebrated 2 birthdays!)they'd get pretty into it.

But, as to the actual film, definately, excellent, waaaaay better than any films I've seen this year, not only because of SFX, but acting and everything else as well. Except for maybe The Mummy Returns.

Spoiler:
Did anyone cry when Boromir died? While I was desperately trying to hold back, I suddenly became aware that the whole cinema was in tears (!), so I kinda just... gave in.


btw, has anyone seen erm... I think it's called... Black Hawk Down? (I might go and see it, but onyl cos it's got Orlando Bloom in!) Sigh, teenage crushes, who needs them...

Andrea-T

Oh my god!

That film was excellent!
I didn't even realise that I had been sat in the cinema for almost three house when it finished! It was a complete masterpiece and everything was fabulous! The acting was great especially from Elijah Wood and Vigo Mortensen (is that spelt right?) and the special effects were out of this world.
I could have easily stayed in the cinema and watched the other two films.
I thought the humour in it was good and quite appropriate too to lighten the story slightly and show the contrast from the bleak moments. Merry and Pippin were great characters played by Billy Boys and Dominic Monaghan from the UK. I am looking forward to seeing more of them in the next two films!

I agree with Venus about Orlando and Vigo but I also think that Elijah was quite cute in the film.

Did anyone else think it was really scary? Having read the book I knew what was coming but it was still downright spooky in the mines and the way that the effects were used when Frodo was wearing the ring.

*spoiler* (cant remember how to do the blue box thing)
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
The scene when Bilbo asked to hold the ring off Frodo in Rivendell was quite shock worthy. I wasn't expecting his face to change like that at all and me and my friends all jumped!


I am gonna read some more of the second book today!!


Happpy Christmas everyone!

Nope Venus, I didn't find that the least bit sad! My sister and friend did though. I don't think that it will be out on Sky by then, I think that tptb are planning on releasing the first on video when the second comes out in the cinema. Or something like that.

The second book is called the Two Towers isn't it?

I've seen it twice now, even better second time round!

The elves don't look as good as I'd thought they would, Legolas and Elrond look the best. I was kind of iffy about Viggo Mortensen as Aragorn but he was great!

Pippen and Merry were hilarious! I can't wait to see them in the next book. (speaking of which you should see the guy who plays Merry! Nice)

Also, there was no way Gandalf would have made it down to Gondor and Isengard then back up in time to meet Frodo, not a chance!

I realised I've been pronouncing all the names wrong as well, way off!
